is the first stop on the Ring of Kerry and renowned for its Puck Fair Festival in August.

Kerry Airport is an international airport and is a 20 min drive from Killorglin. Cork International is a 90 minute drive and Shannon Airport is 2 hours. With 2 International airport within driving distance of Killorglin access is easy. Trains and buses also can be use to get to Killorglin.
Killorglin town is best viewed on foot.  Start at either end of the town and discover the true charm of a Irish town.

value: There are several local shops where you can pick up a unique Irish gift for a loved one.

They love angel shops in Killorglin and there are a number of them including Angel Haven where you can get an angel reading done by a spiritual healer! Its just after the bridge coming into Killorglin.

value: Numerous Restaurant and Pub food available all year round

There are a number of restaurants in Killorglin town including Nicks,the Bianconi,and Jacks restaurant in Cromane. If you want something different try Sol y Sombra Tapas Bar which does tapas at affordable prices and is based in a renovated church dating from the 19th century.

value: With 20+ pubs you will not go thirsty.
B&B's galore and many self-catering options
